column1: Decreased factor VII activity may be related to: - Deficiency of factor VII - Disorder in which the proteins that control blood clotting become over active (disseminated intravascular coagulation) - Fat malabsorption (not absorbing enough fat from your diet) - Liver disease (such as cirrhosis) - Vitamin K deficiency - Taking the blood thinning drug called warfarin (Coumadin)
